alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 20 at 5:48PM PDT until September 20 at 6:45PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Mountain BurnScar in... Southwestern Siskiyou County in northern California... * Until 645 PM PDT. * At 548 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Mountain BurnScar. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding or debris flows remains possible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Mountain BurnScar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Mountain BurnScar. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads is possible. The heavy rains will may trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around the Mountain BurnScar. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous near burn scars in heavy rain. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
